    • parseCommand

      public void parseCommand(String command, String... params) throws IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException
      Description copied from interface: com.GuruGames.games.Commands

      Compares input strings to local command list then calls appropriate method

      Example parseCommand boilerplate for Games

      public void parseCommand(String command, String... params) throws IllegalArgumentException{
          if(params.length == 0){
              if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("help")){System.out.println(help());}
              else{
                  throw new IllegalArgumentException("command not found");
              }
          }
          else {
              throw new IllegalArgumentException("No commands take this many parameters. Compare your command to the commands found by typing `help`");
          }
      }
      Specified by:
      parseCommand in interface com.GuruGames.games.Commands
      Parameters:
      command - String from user containing desired command
      params - String from user containing desired parameter(s)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Invalid command, parameter, or parameter count; .getMessage() should have details.
      InvocationTargetException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException
      NoSuchMethodException
